clinical_study.brief_title: Training Balance Among People With Neurodevelopmental Disabilities
clinical_study.official_title: Training Anticipatory Postural Adjustments Among People With Neurodevelopmental Disabilities

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a case control pilot study to investigate the impact of a short-term intervention on training anticipatory postural adjustments in a population of people with neurodevelopmental disabilities.

detailed_description.textblock: Data will be collected by using a weighted pendulum to provide a posterior perturbation to test subjects' postural reactions pre and post-intervention. Intervention will include four sessions of weighted ball tosses/weighted tether ball stops to improve muscle activation patterns and efficiency. EMG sensors, 3D motion analysis, and force plates will be used to collect the necessary data.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Case control, matched on gender, age, and BMI

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention muscle activation timing will be assessed on the initial visit. Post-intervention muscle activation timing will be assessed immediately after the fourth training session, at most, 7 days later.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation in change in muscle activation timing of anterior tibialis, soleus, gastroc, rectus femoris, biceps femoris, rectus abdominis using electromyography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention muscle amplitude response will be assessed on the initial visit. Post-intervention muscle amplitude response will be assessed immediately after the fourth training session, at most, 7 days later.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation in change in amplitude of anterior tibialis, soleus, gastroc, rectus femoris, biceps femoris, rectus abdominis using electromyography

arm_group.description: Training 4 sessions over a one week time period of 180 catches/stops with a medicine ball.

intervention.description: Participants will stop or catch a weighted ball

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants
1. Able to stand without assistance
2. Diagnosis of cerebral palsy, Down Syndrome, or Autism Spectrum Disorder
3. Able to stop weighted ball without falling
4. Able to follow directions
Controls
1. Able to stand without assistance
2. No neurodeveloopmental disability
3. Able to stop weighted ball without falling
4. Able to follow directions
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy
2. Unable to maintain standing when stopping a ball on a rope
